newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar edges higher but volume slight.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar edges higher but volume slight.

text.p: London white sugar futures got off to a slow start as the benchmark March contract drifted higher and away from support at $300, traders said on Thursday. By 1255 GMT volume had amounted to a light 125 lots, predominantly in March. "There's a little bit of buying around this morning but the voluem is pretty thin, there's nothing really going on," said one trader. March was $1.20 higher at an intraday high of $302.40 and May up 20 cents at $301.10.
Traders said the white premium could be a focus of interest when the raws market opened, as March/March has narrowed to around $67 from $69 earlier this week.
"I would have thought that longer-term the premium does feel like it is going to narrow, if anything," said another trader.
"But it hasn't happened yet and it will probably be the last week or so (before expiry)," he said.
Some traders have said the premium could fall to $60 before the March whites goes off the board on February 13.
Results are still awaited in Libya's buying tender while Turkey is expected to decide on its 50,000-tonne export tender after 1300 GMT on Friday.
Elsewhere, Indonesia said it would import around 500,000 tonnes of sugar in 1997 and a strike by Colombian dock workers at the Pacific port of Buenaventura has halted sugar exports.
Trading was extremely thin on the Paris market where only 27 lots of the spot March contract were posted. The position stood $1.10 higher at $302.10.
